block.p: Alicia Brooke Seidler, a daughter of Charles J. Seidler Jr. of Darien, Conn., and the late Carol Baker Seidler, was married yesterday to Edwin Wells Beck, a son of Mary F. Beck of Harpswell, Me., and John C. Beck of Mount Kisco, N.Y. The Rev. Daniel Warren performed the ceremony at St. Paul's Episcopal Church in Brunswick, Me.
The bride, a graduate of Colgate University, and bridegroom, a Princeton graduate, received M.B.A. degrees from New York University, where they met.

Alicia Brooke Seidler, a daughter of Charles J. Seidler Jr. of Darien, Conn., and the late Carol Baker Seidler, was married yesterday to Edwin Wells Beck, a son of Mary F. Beck of Harpswell, Me., and John C. Beck of Mount Kisco, N.Y. The Rev. Daniel Warren performed the ceremony at St. Paul's Episcopal Church in Brunswick, Me.
The bride, a graduate of Colgate University, and bridegroom, a Princeton graduate, received M.B.A. degrees from New York University, where they met.

Mrs. Beck, 27, is known as Brooke. She is a sales associate at Goldman, Sachs & Company in New York. Her father is a partner in Windels Marx Lane & Mittendorf, a law firm in New York. Her mother was a trustee at Greenwich Academy, a girls' college-preparatory and arts day school in Greenwich, Conn., from which the bride graduated. The bride's stepmother, Janet Prindle, is a managing director of Neuberger Berman, an investment firm in New York.
Mr. Beck, 31, is known as Wells. He is an associate stock analyst at Prudential Securities in New York. His father is a partner in Beck, Mack & Oliver, an investment management firm in New York.
